attributes.action: Leave European Convention on Human Rights & replace Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.additional_details: With conservative estimates of 1.5M migrants in the United Kingdom and over 26,000 (87% male) arriving via the Channel crossing alone in 2021 to date, the government needs to realise the benefits of Brexit and their commitment to Take Back Control of our money, laws and borders.
attributes.background: Honour government’s manifesto pledge to Take Back Control of our money, laws and borders noting the more than trembling of economic migration via the Channel Crossing and other methods. Set up an offshore processing centre for all asylum claims. All undocumented arrivals automatically denied entry.

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about attempts to enter the UK illegally, however it's not clear how replacing the Human Rights Act would address this, nor what you want the Act to be replaced with.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Take action to make entering the UK illegally extremely unattractive for adults': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600378

'Revoke UK-France agreement to tackle illegal immigration': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593478
